definition: eye-catching décor for young children (in classrooms, libraries etc) (posters, mobiles, murals etc) (abbr. for 環境創設|环境创设[huan2 jing4 chuang4 she4])
ring/hoop/loop/(chain) link/classifier for scores in archery etc/to surround/to encircle/to hem in
to begin/to initiate/to inaugurate/to start/to create
design of a learning environment for young children, incorporating artwork designed to appeal to them/abbr. to 環創|环创[huan2 chuang4]
lesson plan/teaching plan/a "missionary case" (a dispute over Christian missionaries during the late Qing)
preschool education/abbr. for 幼兒教育|幼儿教育[you4 er2 jiao4 yu4]
early education (abbr. for 早期教育[zao3 qi1 jiao4 yu4])
qualities that delight children (e.g. bold colors in a picture, anthropomorphized characters in a TV show, the physical challenge of playground equipment)
person in charge of a place that ends in 園|园, such as a vineyard 葡萄園|葡萄园, zoo 動物園|动物园, cemetery 陵園|陵园 etc
blackboard bulletin with short news items written on it (can usually be found in factories, schools etc)
